verbose_text: Previous research reported that activation of the ephrinB2-EphB4 signaling pathway promoted early osteogenic differentiation, leading to earlier osteogenic process and earlier expression of Runx2; However, other research reported that high levels of ephrinB2 overexpression increases the osteogenic differentiation of human mesenchymal stem cells, while no significant changes in Runx2 expression were found when they attempted to elucidate the molecular mechanisms of ephrinB2 overexpression.
evidence: ephrinB2 overexpression increases the osteogenic differentiation
